text: The is a military unit of the Japan Ground Self-Defense Force (JGSDF), based in Tokyo. It is known for being a ceremonial guard of honor and public protection unit of the JGSDF. In wartime situations, the company serves as a military police unit. ==History== The Special Ceremonial Detachment of the 302nd Military Police Company typically mount an honor guard during state visits. It was established in 1959, following a Cabinet Secretariat decision in August 1957 determining that the SDF would established a Special Guard of Honor. Its first honor guard ceremony was held 1 October 1957, when the company honored Prime Minister Nobusuke Kishi during a military parade in front of the Meiji Memorial Picture Gallery. Three days later, Indian Prime Minuster Jawaharlal Nehru became the first to receive a guard of honor as a foreign guest. The company celebrated its 2,500th honor guard when it welcomed the Supreme Commander of the Swedish Armed Forces on 2 March 2015.https://www.mod.go.jp/e/jdf/sp/no62/sp_web-only.html Prior to performing at a welcoming ceremony, it engages in three days worth of training.[JDF PR Video] The Special Guard of Honor of the JGSDF M1 Garands are the standard rifle for the unit.陸自302保安警務中隊へ62年ぶり「新儀仗銃」授与 朝雲新聞(2019年5月30日付) It commonly performs drill routines with cadets from the National Defense Academy of Japan during the JSDF Marching Festival in November.https://www.mod.go.jp/e/jdf/no119/activities.html In October 2015, Prime Minister Shinzo Abe held an award ceremony at the Prime Minister's Office, during which he said "...that Japan’s Special Guard of Honor is the best in the world".https://japan.kantei.go.jp/97_abe/actions/201510/21article1.html ==Duties== Today, it mounts a ceremonial guard when foreign leaders make state visit to Tokyo, usually through being assembled outside the Chōwaden Reception Hall at the Tokyo Imperial Palace or the Prime Minister's Official Residence or Tokyo Haneda Airport.https://www.mod.go.jp/e/jdf/no112/activities.html It also provided a ceremonial guard during the Imperial Funeral of Hirohito in February 1989, the Enthronement Ceremony of Akihito in November 1990, and the 26th G8 summit in July 2000. Outside the company, the Imperial Guard of Japan also performs regular public duties outside the Tokyo Imperial Palace, which is the main residence of the Emperor of Japan. == Structure == The 115-strong company has the following organization: * 1st platoon (three honor guard squads) * 2nd platoon (three honor guard squads) * 3rd platoon (three honor guard squads) During ceremonies in the Special Guard of Honor, the Japan Ground Self-Defense Force Central Band reinforces the company. In addition a platoon of buglers from the JGSDF reinforces the company during military parades to provide additional accompaniment. == Gallery == File:Defense.gov photo essay 070817-F-0193C-014.jpg|General Peter Pace inspecting the company dressed in its white full dress uniform.
